title: Calories in 1/2 Cup of Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in 1/2 cup of rice, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Cooked long-grain white rice, unenriched, boiled without added salt, oil, or butter; ~79 g per 1/2 cup serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, brand, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1/2 cup of cooked white rice provides ~102 kcal and ~22 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1/2 cup of cooked white rice?
What are the carbs in 1/2 cup of rice?
faqs.a: About 22.3 g of carbohydrates, with minimal fiber and sugars.
No, 1/2 cup provides only ~2.2 g protein; pair with other sources for balance.

faqs.q: Calories in 1/2 cup uncooked vs. cooked rice?
faqs.a: Uncooked is denser: ~180 kcal per 1/2 cup dry, but it expands when cooked.

faqs.q: How does rice type affect calories?
faqs.a: Brown rice has slightly more (~117 kcal per 1/2 cup) due to fiber; sticky varieties may vary.
